html: The king of Assyria/Babylon’s boundless ambition extends to being even as the Most High God. Resembling the gods of ancient Near Eastern myth, he seeks to “rise” or “ascend” (’e‘eleh) above the “stars of God”—that is, above those sons of God who have attained celestial glory or exaltation (Psalm 82:6 ;Isaiah 40:26, 31). The mythological “mount of assembly” of the gods is identified with “Zaphon,” the North or Pole Star. Of course, ascent “in the heavens.... above the altitude of the clouds”—as in a counterfeit of celestial exaltation—is possible to attain with today’s space technology.
